title: How to Make Dried Bananas in the Microwave

steps.headline: Peel the banana(s).
steps.description: Slice each banana in ⁄2 centimeter (0.2 in) - 1 centimeter (0.4 in) slices.

steps.headline: Arrange the slices on a microwave roasting rack or plate stacker.
steps.description: You may also use any microwavable container.

steps.headline: Microwave on the defrost mode for 10 to 15 minutes, or until slightly sticky to touch.
steps.description: If you smell burning a few minutes into microwaving them, remove them and make sure it's in defrost next time.

steps.headline: Remove from the microwave.
steps.description: Transfer the slices to a wire cake rack.

tyn: Microwave roasting rack or plate stacker
Airtight container and baking paper for lining
text: Peel the banana(s). Slice each banana in ⁄2 centimeter (0.2 in) - 1 centimeter (0.4 in) slices. Arrange the slices on a microwave roasting rack or plate stacker. You may also use any microwavable container. Microwave on the defrost mode for 10 to 15 minutes, or until slightly sticky to touch. If you smell burning a few minutes into microwaving them, remove them and make sure it's in defrost next time. Remove from the microwave. Transfer the slices to a wire cake rack. Allow to stand overnight.
